guideword.909: FORM: SAME SUBJECT AND OBJECT, SINGULAR
guideword.272: FORM/USE: 'NOT ONLY … BUT ALSO' WITH INVERSION

Can-do statement.1101: Can use linking verb 'be' with complements.
Can-do statement.871: Can use the negative form with an increasing range of regular and irregular verbs.
Can-do statement.909: Can use an increasing range of singular reflexive pronouns with an increasing range of verbs to refer to actions where the subject and object of the verb are the same.
Can-do statement.1103: Can use a wide range of linking verbs with complements.
Can-do statement.272: Can use inverted auxiliary 'do' + the subject after 'not only', to give focus.
Can-do statement.314: Can use 'this' with nouns and noun phrases in a narrative to create a sense of immediacy.

Example.1101:
Because today is my birthday. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH; 2008; Mandarin; Pass)

Martin is from Poland. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH; 2006; Polish; Pass)

My house is very clean. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH; 2009; Bengali; Pass)
Example.871:
I don't need the video because I've got the DVD. (Key English Test, A2, Greek)

You don't bring anything because it's the first day. (Key English Test, A2, Spanish - European)

It doesn't cost very much. (Key English Test, A2, Italian)
Example.909:
I decided to talk to him and introduce myself. (Preliminary English Test; B1; Turkish)

First you should ask yourself if you have enough money for the journey. (Germany; B1 THRESHOLD; 2008; German; Pass)

Lisa told herself to be strong and hoped everything would be alright. (Preliminary English Test for Schools; B1; Vietnamese)

I was really surprised when I read the e-mail. It was from someone who calls himself  the black shadow. (Chile; B1 THRESHOLD; 2004; Spanish - Latin American; Pass)
Example.1103:
There are indeed many ways of doing this and it all seems very confusing. (Denmark; B2 VANTAGE; 1993; Danish; Pass)

The food is a little bit strange but tastes good. (Brazil; B2 VANTAGE; 1993; Portuguese; Pass)

Now the whole house appeared very unfamiliar to me. (France; B2 VANTAGE; 1993; French; Pass)

Alice was so unhappy that she remained silent for a long time. (Hong Kong; B2 VANTAGE; 2001; Chinese; Pass)

I am writing to inform you that there is some incorrect information which appears in The Student Tourist Guidebook you published last year. (China; B2 VANTAGE; 1999; Chinese; Pass)
Example.272:
Indeed, not only did they teach us useful knowledge, but they also organised practical exercises to ensure that we had assimilated all the information. (Greece; C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY; 2006; Greek; Pass)

Furthermore, not only do I speak (and write) in fluent English, but I also speak French, Spanish and Portuguese. (Brazil; C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY; 2004; Mende; Pass)

For me, not only do extreme sports provide satisfaction of achievement, but they also help you to express yourself. (Greece; C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY; 2008; Greek; Pass)
Example.314:
[talking about two characters in a story] There's this flame of passion between them. (France; C2 MASTERY; 1993; French; Pass)

It's a story where there's this old man who makes a marionette that comes to life. (Japan; C2 MASTERY; 2000; Japanese; Pass)

In our group there was this girl, tiny and fragile, very sensitive; she had a special way with words. (C2 MASTERY; 1993; Portuguese; Pass)

prompt.1101:
Create 20 more examples for the grammatical construction on CEFR level A1 in the category "VERBS: linking" with guideword "FORM: 'BE' + COMPLEMENT" and the rule: "Can use linking verb 'be' with complements."

Examples:

Because today is my birthday. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH; 2008; Mandarin; Pass)

Martin is from Poland. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH; 2006; Polish; Pass)

My house is very clean. (A1 BREAKTHROUGH; 2009; Bengali; Pass)

Output format:
1. [EXAMPLE 1]
2. [EXAMPLE 2]
prompt.871:
Create 20 more examples for the grammatical construction on CEFR level A2 in the category "PRESENT: present simple" with guideword "FORM: NEGATIVE " and the rule: "Can use the negative form with an increasing range of regular and irregular verbs."

Examples:

I don't need the video because I've got the DVD. (Key English Test, A2, Greek)

You don't bring anything because it's the first day. (Key English Test, A2, Spanish - European)

It doesn't cost very much. (Key English Test, A2, Italian)

Output format:
1. [EXAMPLE 1]
2. [EXAMPLE 2]
prompt.909:
Create 20 more examples for the grammatical construction on CEFR level B1 in the category "PRONOUNS: reflexive" with guideword "FORM: SAME SUBJECT AND OBJECT, SINGULAR " and the rule: "Can use an increasing range of singular reflexive pronouns with an increasing range of verbs to refer to actions where the subject and object of the verb are the same."

Examples:

I decided to talk to him and introduce myself. (Preliminary English Test; B1; Turkish)

First you should ask yourself if you have enough money for the journey. (Germany; B1 THRESHOLD; 2008; German; Pass)

Lisa told herself to be strong and hoped everything would be alright. (Preliminary English Test for Schools; B1; Vietnamese)

I was really surprised when I read the e-mail. It was from someone who calls himself  the black shadow. (Chile; B1 THRESHOLD; 2004; Spanish - Latin American; Pass)

Output format:
1. [EXAMPLE 1]
2. [EXAMPLE 2]
prompt.1103:
Create 20 more examples for the grammatical construction on CEFR level B2 in the category "VERBS: linking" with guideword "FORM: LINKING + COMPLEMENT" and the rule: "Can use a wide range of linking verbs with complements."

Examples:

There are indeed many ways of doing this and it all seems very confusing. (Denmark; B2 VANTAGE; 1993; Danish; Pass)

The food is a little bit strange but tastes good. (Brazil; B2 VANTAGE; 1993; Portuguese; Pass)

Now the whole house appeared very unfamiliar to me. (France; B2 VANTAGE; 1993; French; Pass)

Alice was so unhappy that she remained silent for a long time. (Hong Kong; B2 VANTAGE; 2001; Chinese; Pass)

I am writing to inform you that there is some incorrect information which appears in The Student Tourist Guidebook you published last year. (China; B2 VANTAGE; 1999; Chinese; Pass)

Output format:
1. [EXAMPLE 1]
2. [EXAMPLE 2]
prompt.272:
Create 20 more examples for the grammatical construction on CEFR level C1 in the category "CONJUNCTIONS: coordinating" with guideword "FORM/USE: 'NOT ONLY … BUT ALSO' WITH INVERSION" and the rule: "Can use inverted auxiliary 'do' + the subject after 'not only', to give focus."

Examples:

Indeed, not only did they teach us useful knowledge, but they also organised practical exercises to ensure that we had assimilated all the information. (Greece; C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY; 2006; Greek; Pass)

Furthermore, not only do I speak (and write) in fluent English, but I also speak French, Spanish and Portuguese. (Brazil; C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY; 2004; Mende; Pass)

For me, not only do extreme sports provide satisfaction of achievement, but they also help you to express yourself. (Greece; C1 EFFECTIVE OPERATIONAL PROFICIENCY; 2008; Greek; Pass)

Output format:
1. [EXAMPLE 1]
2. [EXAMPLE 2]
prompt.314:
Create 20 more examples for the grammatical construction on CEFR level C2 in the category "DETERMINERS: demonstratives" with guideword "USE: 'THIS', IN NARRATIVES" and the rule: "Can use 'this' with nouns and noun phrases in a narrative to create a sense of immediacy."

Examples:

[talking about two characters in a story] There's this flame of passion between them. (France; C2 MASTERY; 1993; French; Pass)

It's a story where there's this old man who makes a marionette that comes to life. (Japan; C2 MASTERY; 2000; Japanese; Pass)

In our group there was this girl, tiny and fragile, very sensitive; she had a special way with words. (C2 MASTERY; 1993; Portuguese; Pass)

Output format:
1. [EXAMPLE 1]
2. [EXAMPLE 2]

1101: The book is on the table.
The game is on TV tonight.
It is important to be kind.
The party is at my house.
871: I don't like coffee, I prefer tea.
She doesn't live in the city, she lives in the countryside.
We don't eat meat, we are vegetarian.
They don't understand the instructions, they need more guidance.
He doesn't play the guitar, he plays the piano.
The dog doesn't bark at strangers, it is friendly.
I don't know the answer, can you help me?
She doesn't wear glasses, her vision is perfect.
We don't have any homework today, it's a day off.
They don't work on Sundays, it's their day off.
He doesn't speak French, he only knows English and Spanish.
The bus doesn't arrive on time, it's always late.
I don't enjoy watching horror movies, they scare me.
She doesn't like spicy food, it's too hot for her.
They don't play football, they prefer basketball.
He doesn't smoke, he quit last year.
We don't go out for dinner often, we prefer to cook at home.
The cat doesn't like water, it avoids getting wet.
909: He bought himself a new car for his birthday.
She couldn't believe how well she had performed in the exam.
The teacher reminded the students to always believe in themselves.
John decided to challenge himself by running a marathon.
Sarah woke up early so she could have some time to herself before work.
They promised to take care of themselves and stay healthy.
We should always be kind to ourselves and practice self-love.
He blamed himself for the mistake and promised to do better next time.
She spent the weekend pampering herself with spa treatments.
The little boy was proud of himself for tying his own shoelaces.
They advised each other to always be true to themselves.
I can't believe I actually made this delicious cake all by myself.
She reminded herself to stay positive and not let negativity affect her.
He challenged himself to learn a new language in just six months.
The girl comforted herself by listening to her favorite music.
They congratulated themselves for finishing the project ahead of schedule.
The team leader encouraged everyone to push themselves to reach their goals.
I need to remind myself to take a break and relax from time to time.
She promised herself to make healthier choices and exercise regularly.
He found himself lost in the beauty of the sunset.
1103: The movie seems really interesting but ends up being quite disappointing.
My sister is a talented artist and paints beautiful landscapes.
The weather feels chilly but the sun is shining brightly.
The cat looks sleepy but is actually very playful.
The coffee tastes bitter but I still enjoy it.
John was exhausted after the long day at work and fell asleep immediately.
The book appears complicated at first glance but becomes clearer as you read on.
The house smells like delicious homemade cookies.
The music sounds soothing and helps me relax.
The students are confident and speak fluently during the presentation.
The car seems old but runs smoothly without any issues.
The new employee appears nervous but quickly adapts to the work environment.
The situation seems hopeless but there is always a solution.
The problem looks challenging but can be solved with some effort.
The party feels lively and energetic with everyone dancing and having fun.
The dress appears expensive but was actually bought at a discount.
The concert sounded amazing with the band's flawless performance.
The project is difficult but worth the effort.
The decision seems difficult but is necessary for our progress.
The atmosphere feels tense but everyone remains calm and focused.
272: Not only did she win the race, but she also broke the previous record.
Not only does he play the guitar, but he also sings beautifully.
Not only did they read the book, but they also discussed its themes and symbols.
Not only is she a talented dancer, but she is also an amazing choreographer.
Not only did they clean the house, but they also cooked a delicious meal.
Not only does he enjoy playing soccer, but he also loves watching the sport on TV.
Not only did she finish her homework early, but she also studied for an extra hour.
Not only is he an excellent student, but he is also a dedicated athlete.
Not only did they visit the museum, but they also attended a lecture about art history.
Not only do they offer amazing customer service, but they also have high-quality products.
Not only did he fix the car, but he also gave it a thorough clean.
Not only is she a talented pianist, but she can also compose her own music.
Not only did they win the game, but they also demonstrated great sportsmanship.
Not only do they provide a comfortable stay, but they also offer fantastic amenities.
Not only did she pass the exam, but she also received the highest score in the class.
Not only is he an incredible chef, but he also owns a successful restaurant.
Not only did they finish the project on time, but they also exceeded all expectations.
Not only does she have a successful career, but she also volunteers in her community.
Not only did they solve the problem, but they also implemented a solution to prevent it from happening again.
Not only is she a talented actress, but she is also a published author.
314: She was telling me about this incredible adventure she had while traveling through the Amazon rainforest.
As I reached the final chapter of the book, there was this unexpected twist that left me speechless.
The protagonist of the story encountered this mysterious stranger who would change his life forever.
In the middle of the night, there was this loud knock on the door that startled everyone in the house.
I remember this moment vividly, when the protagonist finally confronted his fears and climbed the highest mountain.
While exploring the haunted mansion, there was this eerie silence that made our hearts race.
In the midst of chaos, there was this small ray of hope that kept everyone going.
As the storm approached, there was this strong gust of wind that blew all the leaves off the trees.
He was known for his impeccable fashion sense, always wearing this stylish hat that caught everyone's attention.
This beautiful painting hung on the wall, capturing the essence of an idyllic countryside scene.
The play took place in this grand theater, filled with history and charm.
There was this abandoned house at the end of the street, rumored to be haunted by restless spirits.
As the detective entered the crime scene, there was this overwhelming smell of blood in the air.
In the darkness of the forest, there was this eerie glow coming from a hidden cave.
We stumbled upon this hidden gem of a restaurant in the heart of the city, serving exquisite cuisine.
The main character possessed this extraordinary power that allowed her to manipulate time.
As the spaceship landed on a distant planet, there was this breathtaking view of the alien landscape.
The protagonist encountered this wise old sage, who provided guidance and wisdom throughout the journey.
There was this overwhelming sense of anticipation as the final match of the championship approached.
In the middle of the battlefield, there was this deafening explosion that sent shockwaves through the soldiers.

1101: Today feels like a sunny day.
My house appears to be very clean.
The flowers give off a beautiful vibe.
It seems to be hot outside.
The book lays on the table.
The movie comes across as interesting.
The dog behaves in a friendly manner.
The car carries a red color.
The game airs on TV tonight.
It holds great importance to be kind.
The exams prove to be difficult.
The party takes place at my house.
The music emits a loud sound.
The room displays a messy appearance.
The shoes provide comfort when worn.

We prefer to cook at home, we don't go out for dinner often.

I find the whole house very unfamiliar now.

I not only speak (and write) in fluent English, but I also speak French, Spanish and Portuguese.
